results.headline: Vampire Girls Just Want to Have Dates
results.summary_short: In “Vamps” the vampire heroines, played by Alicia Silverstone and Krysten Ritter, have problems dating human men.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Vamps

results.headline: Relentless Raccoons and Other Suburban Problems Money Can’t Always Fix
results.summary_short: “The Details” chronicles the darkly comic descent of a blithely amoral physician, played by Tobey Maguire, after a stoned evening with his best friend’s wife.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Details

results.headline: After Death, the Show and the Sub Must Go On
results.summary_short: In “The Understudy” a young Off Broadway actress commits an accidental sort of homicide that keeps putting her onstage in the star’s place.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Understudy

results.headline: The Swordsman’s Arms Dealer of Choice (Wires Not Included)
results.summary_short: In “The Man With the Iron Fists,” the hip-hop artist RZA of the Wu-Tang Clan has assembled a homage to the martial arts genre known as wuxia.
results.display_title: The Man With the Iron Fists

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Man With the Iron Fists

results.headline: Adolescent Aches in a Belgian Coastal Town
results.summary_short: In “North Sea Texas” a sensitive teenage boy trapped in a tiny Belgian coastal town grows infatuated with the boy next door.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of North Sea Texas

results.headline: Girl Interrupted by the Emotional Whammy of Love
results.summary_short: In “Jack & Diane” a British naïf on a New York City vacation is unprepared for love.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jack and Diane

results.headline: Therapy From a Mountaintop
results.summary_short: The documentary “High Ground” follows 11 wounded war veterans as they scale a 20,000-foot peak in the Himalayas.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of High Ground

results.headline: Grown Up and Going Back to Guyana
results.summary_short: “Festival of Lights” concerns a mother and daughter who have fled Guyana to seek a better life in New York.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Festival of Lights

results.headline: Revisiting the Heady Days of Dogtown
results.summary_short: “Bones Brigade” is Stacy Peralta’s latest installment on the American subculture of skateboarding.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bones Brigade: An Autobiography

results.headline: There’s Something Bubbling Off the Shore of a Chesapeake Hamlet
results.summary_short: “The Bay” is a collage of escalating grossness, as innocent, water-based fun turns into a grisly epidemic fueled by ecological malfeasance.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Bay

results.headline: Designer’s Life, Stressful but Not a Stitch Out of Place
results.summary_short: “A Man’s Story” is a documentary on the life of Ozwald Boateng, the London fashion designer.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Man's Story

results.headline: Captured by a Camera, a Poetry of Lost and Missed Connections
results.summary_short: In “Gregory Crewdson: Brief Encounters,” the director Ben Shapiro follows this photographer for four years as he works on a major series, “Beneath the Roses.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gregory Crewdson: Brief Encounters

results.headline: A Mile a Minute in One Long Nightmare
results.summary_short: A teenager encounters a pyramid-headed executioner, harpy-like nurses and a creature cobbled from mannequin limbs.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Silent Hill: Revelation 3D

results.headline: Early Stones, Presented as Diamonds in the Rough
results.summary_short: “The Rolling Stones: Charlie Is My Darling” reveals the intensity of rock ’n’ roll at a time when it still felt risky and thrilling.
results.display_title: The Rolling Stones: Charlie Is My Darling

results.headline: Culture Wars in the School Board
results.summary_short: The documentary “The Revisionaries” looks at the Texas Board of Education and its agenda over school textbooks.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Revisionaries

results.headline: Halloween Till Dawn
results.summary_short: The Nickelodeon star Victoria Justice plays a high-school student chasing down her lost little brother on Halloween in “Fun Size.”

results.headline: Parents Who Are Left Holding the Truth, Palestinian or Israeli
results.summary_short: In “The Other Son,” there are psychological and political consequences when children living along the Palestinian-Israeli divide are switched at birth.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Other Son

results.headline: Two Hikers Who Need to Watch Their Steps
results.summary_short: In “The Loneliest Planet” Gael García Bernal and Hani Furstenberg play a couple on a pre-wedding hiking trip in the Caucasus Mountains.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Loneliest Planet

results.headline: Maybe She Forgot to Tip the Super
results.summary_short: The director Jaume Balagueró’s “Sleep Tight” watches an apartment building concierge who is watching, and tormenting, a resident of the building.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sleep Tight

results.headline: Cocaine Peddler Pays a Bloody Price
results.summary_short: Richard Coyle and Agyness Deyn star in a British remake of a Danish crime drama that came from Nicolas Winding Refn, the director of “Drive.”
